Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2013 09:45PM Lee1963 wrote: Hi everyone. Had surgery yesterday, all went as planned with no problems. I'm feeling incredibly well. I expected to be much more uncomfortable then I am. Had difficulty sleeping last night but caught a few good naps today. Summergal, so happy for your results!! Hope mine are the same. Katlebbie, hope you are well and recovering nicely. All the best, and healing energy to those still waiting for surgery. :)
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2013 01:55AM Lee1963 wrote: Hi Ladies, I'm new here and new to all of this. I discovered a lump at the beginning of August, had a biopsy on the 28th, received results on September 4th. I had my BS appointment yesterday (16th). I am having a lumpectomy with SN dissection on the 20th. Very nervous, haven't heard about the 'wires' until I read about them here. Is this standard? I know about the dye injection...sounded like the worst part of the whole ordeal to me...that is until I read about the wires. Can anyone explain this to me? I probably won't hear from surgeon before Friday, so this would be very helpful. Thanks :)
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2013 12:47PM Lee1963 wrote: Thanks Sandymomto3, Summergal, and Mamasixtaz. Your comments really helped. My BS office is calling me back today so I can ask questions. You are all such a wonderful source of support to one another, I feel blessed that I found this site! I too will have you all in my thoughts as we go through this. Summergal, sending positive energy for your path results. :)
